News Title: Intel Will Cut Over 15,000 Jobs Amid Struggles to Turn Itself Around
News Abstract: The Silicon Valley chip maker also reported a net loss and declining revenue in the latest quarter.
News Content: Intel, the Silicon Valley chip maker, said on Thursday that it would slash more than 15,000 jobs to aid a turnaround plan, as the company tries to recover after a series of stumbles.

News Title: As Regulators Close In, Nvidia Scrambles for a Response
News Abstract: With a 90 percent share of the A.I. chip market, the company is facing antitrust investigations into the possibility that it could lock in customers or hurt competitors.
News Content: Nvidia rocketed to the top of the tech industry by providing the computer chips essential to building artificial intelligence. By the end of last year, it had more than a 90 percent share of those chips sold around the world.

News Title: The Economy Moves to Center Stage in the Election
News Abstract: Inflation is cooling but hiring is slowing as Kamala Harris and Donald Trump fine tune their pitch to voters.
News Content: As Vice President Kamala Harris hits the road to start spelling out her economic agenda, she could point to recent progress in the inflation fight that has hounded the Biden administration and Democrats for the past two years.

News Title: How Costco Hacked the American Shopping Psyche
News Abstract: More than 100 million people visit the retailer for their groceries — and gas and TVs and gold bars and pet coffins — but saving money may not be the only motive.
News Content: When it opened in 1984, the Costco on West Dimond Boulevard in Anchorage did not seem like the future of food. A glorified shed the color of stale coffee, the warehouse offered the sort of products and deals Alaskans go crazy for: mammoth quantities of staples like peanut butter and tomato sauce, along with local favorites such as caribou sausage. The state’s extreme environment and the need to travel hours or even days for groceries made it a hit right off the bat.

News Title: Nvidia Revenue Jumps 122% in Positive Sign for Tech’s A.I. Boom
News Abstract: Expectations for the chipmaker have been through the roof because of its dominance in a key component for artificial intelligence systems.
News Content: This summer, Wall Street and Silicon Valley began to question whether generative artificial intelligence could produce enough benefits to justify its staggering costs.

News Title: Nvidia Holds the Key to the Market. But Is It Worth This Much?
News Abstract: One of the hazards of buying individual stocks is that their current price may have little to do with their fundamental value, our columnist says.
News Content: Nvidia designs most of the advanced chips that power artificial intelligence, and that has made it an earnings machine, producing astonishing profits that have buoyed the entire stock market.

News Title: The Chinese Chipmaker at the Heart of the U.S.-China Tech War
News Abstract: Efforts by the Beijing-backed Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corporation, or SMIC, to break through innovation barriers have landed it in a geopolitical tech battle.
News Content: In a sprawling factory in eastern Shanghai, where marshy plains have long since been converted into industrial parks, China’s most advanced chipmaker has been hard at work testing the limits of U.S. authority.

News Abstract: A Senate committee report on the Secret Service’s inability to protect the former president at a July event
News Content: A Senate committee report on the Secret Service’s inability to protect the former president at a July event

News Title: How Intel Got Left Behind in the A.I. Chip Boom
News Abstract: Intel was for decades Silicon Valley’s dominant chip company. But missed opportunities and poor execution left it on the sidelines in tech’s latest gold rush.
News Content: In 2005, there was no inkling of the artificial intelligence boom that would come years later. But directors at Intel, whose chips served as electronic brains in most computers, faced a decision that might have altered how that transformative technology evolved.

News Title: The White House Bet Big on Intel. Will It Backfire?
News Abstract: A plan to revive U.S. chip manufacturing rests partly on a company that is firing workers and delaying factories, even as the government pushes for the opposite.
News Content: At an annual gathering of tech executives and billionaires in Sun Valley, Idaho, this past July, Gina Raimondo commandeered a table near a duck pond and tried to exert her influence as the U.S. secretary of commerce to help rescue an ailing national champion.

News Title: Intel Posts $16.6 Billion Quarterly Loss, Its Biggest Ever
News Abstract: The Silicon Valley chip maker has struggled to turn around its fortunes after missing opportunities and poor execution.
News Content: Intel on Thursday posted the biggest quarterly loss in its 56-year history, as the onetime highflying chip maker struggles to turn itself around.
